title: Graphs of Log Functions - Vertical Asymptotes

content.question: Let <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals ln x"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mi>x</mi></math> and <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3 ln open parentheses x plus 2 close parentheses"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>ln</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>. In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, which of the following statements about the vertical asymptotes of the graphs of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is true?

choices.label: The vertical asymptote of the graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is shifted <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math> units to the left of the vertical asymptote of the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>.

The vertical asymptote of the graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is shifted <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math> units to the right of the vertical asymptote of the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>.

The vertical asymptote of the graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is shifted <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> units to the left of the vertical asymptote of the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>.

The vertical asymptote of the graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is shifted <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> units to the right of the vertical asymptote of the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>.

content.answer: The vertical asymptote of the graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is shifted <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> units to the left of the vertical asymptote of the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>.
